title: Tiamat should have a second upgrade aside from Hydra
body:
Procs on-hit effects on it's splash damage, no active function. ( you can't click it to do damage )

So it should build out of {{item:3077}} + new on-hit item OR {{item:1042}} 

Meaning less AD and more AS/on-hit ability, for waveclear purposes!

Yay?

Disagree.

Tiamat+stinger= Hydras tooth
Hydras tooth: 3400g
+50AD
+40% ASP
+20% CDR
Unique passive: Rapid cleave: each attack spawns 3 shockwaves (cleave size) with do 25% damage per shockwave to surrounding enemies. 
Unique active: Cleave: Same as cleave

Tiamat+keepers armguard= Hydra scale guantlet
Hydra scale gauntlet: 3150g
+45 AD
+45 Armor
Unique passive: Gain 2.5% of your max health as AD
Unique active: Cleave

imo the first item could work, but would feel clunky. ( because AS+CDR can often be conflicting )

The second one.. Where did the AP go? And how/why are you getting AD out of an AP tank item? lol.

The AP is converted into the passive ;3
Well I'm sure what you mean isn't an AP -> HP item, but that would be a cool mechanic now that I think of it.

> [{quoted}](name=YOU BEEN WARNED,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FZFruYeA,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-02T05:29:40.324+0000)
>
> Well I'm sure what you mean isn't an AP -> HP item, but that would be a cool mechanic now that I think of it.

It would bringing back atmas impaler... But give it a much more useful build path. 
Generally, the champions who rush tiamat also at least slight AP ratios. And the entire reason why atmas was never bought by people, was because it was armor+crit. Very champions would benefit from such a strange stat combo. 

Also, keepers armguard is a great defensive item :3
So you want it to be broken and lose functionality, got it.

It's not broken, cleave proc to secondary targets deals 60% -> 100% of total damage. This should apply to on-hit effects as well, it is still an expensive offensive item with above average stats; so bruisers who get it have to be ahead otherwise they are sacrificing a big deal of defense.

One, on-hit effects don't scale down. Ever.

Two, on-hit effects are balanced around the fact that they aren't applied everywhere at once. Giving everyone Shyvana's dragon Q is a staggeringly bad idea that can and will have a number of unforeseen consequences.

One, they should be programmed that way if the idea is to be taken into consideration.

Two, URF was a result of an idea with a number of unforseen consequences; besides this is not giving everyone shyvanna's dragon Q because that one is an auto attack reset + 2 autos & realistically you won't apply it everywhere unless the enemy has a lot of melee champions that let you do what you want.

Why would you build this item over a {{item:3153}} if you're an on-hit bruiser ? If you're buying it, you're buying it on top of the botrk/{{item:3091}}. Which is a squishy/carryish build style with clear strengths & weaknesses.

Sure, it will give on-hitters more damage late game. But it comes at the cost of a defensive item slot, something on-hit champions highly need.
